goodlife.title: Goodlife #sexysmartstrong
goodlife.description: I was the lead developer on the #sexysmartstrong website while at Arcane. A beautiful campaign, the #sexysmartstrong website pulled in Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram posts to build a never ending page of people eating, living, and being better while posting about it online with the #sexysmartstrong hashtag. I also got to build out a fun little quiz that, after answering a dozen questions, would return with your "Sprit Animal". It was a very fun project!

everspring.title: Everspring Farms
everspring.description: Everspring Farms was a fun project I developed while at Arcane that connected a Concrete5 framework for the branded website aspects with a drupal online store, since the client wasn't interested in having Arcane re-do their store.

turkstra.title: Turkstra
turkstra.description: A multi-site project, I was the lead developer at Arcane working on developing several cohesive, connected websites that, while all unique, worked together to create a smooth experience. All websites were built on Concrete5 to allow easy data management for the client.

athleticfluency.title: Athletic Fluency
athleticfluency.description: A local company, Athletic Fluency wants to make waves in the London athletic crowd. To help with that, they asked for a simple, 1 page website to showcase their differences and achievements. Built on Concrete5, this website was designed to expand their influence and help put them on the map.

teaseandcompany.title: Tease & Company
teaseandcompany.description: A local company, Tease & Company wanted a fun, clean website to help further their brand and increase their online presence. Designed by Alicia Bulhoes (https://github.com/aliciabulhoes), this website was built on Concrete5 to make it easy for the client to update and manage their own content.

iecs.title: IECS
iecs.description: A company I was connected with through Fanshawe's Reactr team, I took on the project halfway through to work closely with the company's engineers to build out a calculator that, when given all the data, will return the proper product IECS can supply for the project. This project was built on CodeIgniter with Javascript, and was a very fun experience with some intense math functions.
